title: Pullchain's over—if you want it.
content:
Available immediately for download [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312053233/http:/fontstruct.fontshop.com/fontstructions/show/15854) at FontShop (FontStruct account required).

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312053233im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture2cppy_3896.png)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312053233im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture4copy_6126.png)

Lesson learned: Don't fight the format.
author: David Sudweeks

comments.content:
Ooh Lovely! Link? Or do we have to do the legwork? ;^P

[Edit: I am blinder than a bat. Can we get the link color to pop a bit more? ;^P]
[I am not as blind as a bat but still struggle with the](http://web.archive.org/)link [colour.](http://web.archive.org/)

One word of caution to anyone using this font in print: Because of its very small relative size the dots are rendered by FontStruct as diagonal lumpy cardioids, instead of circles. Because the problems associated with relative size are a " [known issue](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312053233/http:/fontstruct.fontshop.com/faq/fonts/why_do_i_have_to_use_such_a_huge_point_size)" we may be able to assume that the rendering will get better over time.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312053233im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture6_4377.png)

Very nice work David.  
And... Advanced \> View \> Filters \> Brick Size sliders rightward = instant bold!

David, thank you. I love it.

Sharon

Hey Craig, Thanks! I'm on it!

(edit)  
And a few minutes later. [Pullchain Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312053233/http:/fontstruct.fontshop.com/fontstructions/show/93995) rolls off the line.

You're welcome. I also recently realized you can drag a shape from the lower shape palette on top of the "used shapes" above and batch convert them. Make all your dots hexagons, etc. I played around with this with Pullchain a bit, but didn't find anything that worked better than your circles.

Thanks Mark Simonson for the 3D glasses.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312053233im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture7_4769.png)

Great work, David.

Regarding link color, sometimes I add "strong" tags around my links, to make them stand out a bit more.

Like [**this**](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312053233/http:/fontstruct.fontshop.com/fontstructions/show/15854) instead of [this](http://web.archive.org/web/20150312053233/http:/fontstruct.fontshop.com/fontstructions/show/15854). :-)
